alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 12:50PM CDT until April 06 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a deep primed snowpack leading to increased melting. Flows in rivers increased quickly and are forecasted to remain in minor flooding. Dry and warm conditions expected over the next few days, resulting in continually melting snow. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecasted to continue. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 47.0 feet, Some rural roads may begin to flood including county Highway VV downstream near the La Crosse County line. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 47.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 47.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 48.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 48.8 feet on 04/12/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued near 10 PM CDT.
